p: Root nodules were sampled from M. pudica and two varieties of M. diplotricha var. inermis (Adelbert) Verdcourt. and var. diplotricha, growing in 25 locations of five Chinese provinces in the subtropical and tropic regions ( Figure 1), as described previously ( Liu et al., 2007). Root nodules were collected from three plant individuals at each site and were stored over silica gel in closed vials until their isolation in the laboratory ( Vincent, 1970). Root nodule bacteria were isolated and purified from the nodules on yeast mannitol agar (YMA) using the standard procedure ( Vincent, 1970). The nodule isolates obtained in this study were maintained in yeast mannitol broth (YMB) supplied with 20% (v/v) glycerol at −80°C.
